Address.university_name: Hayastani Azgayin Polytekhnikakan Hamalsaran (NPUA)

GeneralInformation.History: National Polytechnic University of Armenia, the legal successor of Yerevan Polytechnic Institute (YerPI) was founded in 1933. In 1991, YerPI was reorganized into State Engineering University of Armenia (SEUA), which was reestablished and renamed as 'National Polytechnic University of Armenia' Foundation (NPUA) in November, 2014. The central campus of NPUA is located in Yerevan (the Capital City), and the branch campuses – in Gyumri, Vanadsor and Kapan, thus embracing in its sphere all the industrial regions of the country. The University has a leading role in the reformations of the higher education system of Armenia. NPUA is a member of European University Association (EUA), the Black Sea Universities Network (BSUN), the Association of Technical Universities of the RF, Network University of CIS countries, etc.
GeneralInformation.AcademicYear: September to June included (First semester: September-January; Second semester: February-June)
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate and entrance examination

Divisions.Details: The Gyumri campus of NPUA was founded in 1959 (at present, the Gyumri branch of the National Polytechnic University of Armenia)

The Kapan Campus of NPUA started its functioning in 1984, initially - as a Training-Consulting Centre and later, in 1997 it was reorganized as a campus of NPUA to meet the needs of growing economy of the Syunik region
Vanadzor branch of National Polytechnic University of Armenia (NPUA) was founded in 1959 with the object to prepare highly qualified engineers to meet demands of industrial companies of Lori region

The Institute offers Undergraduate and Graduate programs in Power Engineering, Energy Management, Environmental Protection Engineering, Economics and Programs encompassing all aspects of Electrical Engineering

Divisions.College: Information and Communication Technologies and Electronics
Mechanical Engineering, Machine-Building, Transportation Systems and Design

Divisions.Details: The Institute provides a comprehensive education aimed at preparing qualified specialists in the fields of mining and mineral extraction, metallurgy, chemical technologies of organic and inorganic materials
